p: Univariate logistic analysis showed that influenza A virus infection was associated with an increased risk of invasive ventilation ( OR: 2.811, 95% CI: 1.905–4.167, P < 0.001) and admittance to the ICU ( OR: 1.651, 95% CI: 1.204–1.204, P = 0.002), but did not correlate with 30-day mortality ( OR: 1.065, 95% CI: 0.775–1.463, P = 0.698) in Flu-p patients (Table 3).
